Report Object¶

This class is your your main entry point to the epyk framework, this is where you’ll be able to access UI components through the UI Interface interfaces or the Javascript Interface features. It takes care of writing the body section of your html page and also populating the style and scripts parts.

There are 5 main interfaces available through this object which will enable you to build a complete HTML page:

  • UI Interface

  • HTML Interface

  • Javascript Interface

  • Outputs Interface

  • Python Interface

  • Data Interface

class epyk.core.Page.Report¶
property body¶

Property that returns the Body element of the HTML page

property css¶

Returns the set of CSS Classes for the HTML report

property data¶

Python internal data source management

This can be extended by inheriting from this epyk.core.data.DataSrc.DataSrc and adding extra entry points

Returns

The framework available data source

dumps(data)¶

Function used to dump the data before being sent to the Javascript layer This function relies on json.dumps with a special encoder in order to work with Numpy array and Pandas data structures.

As NaN is not valid on the Json side those object are not allowed during the dump. It is advised to use fillna() in your script before returning the data to the framework to avoid this issue.

Example:

report.dumps(result)

Related Pages:

https://docs.python.org/2/library/json.html

Parameters

data – The python dictionary or data structure

Returns

The serialised data

property entities¶

Shortcut to the HTML Entities

Related Pages:

https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_entities.asp

Those can be added in string in order to improve the render of a text.

export()¶

Static component export for Angular

property headers¶

Property to the HTML page header

imports(online=False)¶

Return the Import Manager, which allows to import automatically packages for certain components to run.

item(itemId)¶
Parameters

itemId –

Returns

itemFromCode(htmlCode)¶
Parameters

htmlCode –

Return type

html.Html.Html

property js¶

Go to the Javascript section. Property to get all the JavaScript features. Most of the standard modules will be available in order to add event and interaction to the Js transpiled

Usage:

js.console.log("test")

Related Pages:

https://www.w3schools.com/js/default.asp

Returns

Python HTML object

property outs¶
Returns

property py¶

Python external module section.

Related Pages:

https://www.w3schools.com/js/default.asp

Returns

Python HTML object

register(ext_components)¶

This function allows you to register external epyk objects (namely coming from Pyk Reports) by registering them you this will engrave the object within your report The example below will add obj1 and obj2 from an external pyk report previously required, then create a div and then add obj3 from an external file

rptObj.register([obj1, obj2]) rptObj.ui.div(‘this is a div’) rptObj.register(obj3)

property symbols¶

Shortcut to the HTML symbols

Related Pages:

https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_symbols.asp https://www.w3schools.com/charsets/ref_utf_math.asp

Those can be added in string in order to improve the render of a text.

property theme¶

Return the currently used CSS Themes for the report

property ui¶

User Interface section.

All the components which can be used in the dashboard to display the data. Within this object different categories of items can be used like (list, simple text, charts…)

Related Pages:

https://www.w3schools.com/html/default.asp

Return type

Components.Components

Returns

Python HTML object
